channel.title: My timer, set perfectly at eye's first gaze, doesn't work

item.title: My timer, set perfectly at eye's first gaze, doesn't work
item.dc:creator: @o.O_O.o o.O O.o
item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

case 2561: //Baker if(thiefTimer == 0) { if(playerLevel[17] >= 15) { theifTimer = 2; addItem(391, 1); setAnimation(881); sendMessage("You steal a manta ray."); addSkillXP(250, 17); } else if(playerLevel[17] <= 14) { sendMessage("You must have 15 thieving to steal from this stall."); } } break;

Just a little thieving I put together. Why doesn’t the timer work? My woodcutting timers work, and they’re set up the exact same…

I’m going through all my stalls, starting from level one. I got to 60, and the timer was fine:

case 2563: //Fur if(theifTimer == 0) { if(playerLevel[17] >= 60) { theifTimer = 2; addItem(948, 1); setAnimation(881); sendMessage("You steal from the fur stall."); addSkillXP(1500, 17); } else if(playerLevel[17] <= 59) { sendMessage("You must have 60 thieving to steal from this stall."); } } break;

I SEE NO DIFFERENCE!!!

Read full topic
item.source: My timer, set perfectly at eye's first gaze, doesn't work
